raytracer.data
Class Mesh.Vertice

java.lang.Object
  raytracer.data.Mesh.Vertice
Enclosing class:
Mesh
public class Mesh.Vertice
extends java.lang.Object

A single vertice on a Mesh.

REMARK: I made Vertice an innerclass of Mesh because:

  1. A Vertice can't exist without a Mesh.
  2. A Vertice can now behave as a normal object to the outside but it's implementation remains a set of efficient operations on the same matrix.

Author:
Karsten Daemen

Method Summary
 Vector asVector()
           Writes the coordinates of this vertice as a 3x1 vector in matrix starting from the position (startRow, startCol).
 Vector getNormal()
           Returns the normal on this vertice as 3x1 vector (not normalised).
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

asVector

public Vector asVector()

Writes the coordinates of this vertice as a 3x1 vector in matrix starting from the position (startRow, startCol).

  • The element in (startRow, startCol) is the x coordinate.
  • The element in (startRow+1, startCol) is the y coordinate
  • The element in (startRow+2, startCol) is the z coordinate

getNormal

public Vector getNormal()

Returns the normal on this vertice as 3x1 vector (not normalised).

  • The element in (startRow, 0) is the x coordinate of the normal.
  • The element in (startRow+1, 0) is the y coordinate of the normal.
  • The element in (startRow+2, 0) is the z coordinate of the normal.
